title: How to Create a Zip File in Windows

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+E.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + E . This opens the Windows File Explorer.

steps.title: Navigate to the folder that contains files you want to zip.
steps.content: Navigate to the folder that contains files you want to zip.

steps.title: Select all files you want to add to the zip.
steps.content: Select all files you want to add to the zip. To select multiple files at once, hold the Ctrl key as you click each file.

steps.title: Right-click a selected file.
steps.content: Right-click a selected file. A context menu will appear.

steps.title: Select Send to.
steps.content: Select Send to . Additional options will expand.

steps.title: Click Compressed (zipped) folder.
steps.content: Click Compressed (zipped) folder . This creates a new folder with a default file name.

steps.title: Type a new name for the zip and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type a new name for the zip and press ↵ Enter . The selected files are now compressed into the new zip file. To add additional files to the zip, just drag them to the file in the File Explorer.
